Have any of you experienced issues with CSS that has passed through HubSpot’s “minification”? .. I’m having issues with direct stylesheets (uploaded to Design Manager, not File Manager) and the minification that happens here.
The stylesheets are already minified when I upload them, and they are then re-minified in HubSpot - Something seems to be buggy with the 2nd minification though, because some values are left invalid.
Examples, all the minified code is _as seen by browser_, first case is on my local test, second is in HubSpot.
*Transparent colors* - Raw code: `color: rgba(255, 255, 255, .5);`, minified code: `color: hsla(0, 0%, 100%, 0);`, HubSpot minified code `color: hsla(0, 0, 100%, 0);` - Notice the missing `%` in HubSpot’s code. This causes Chrome to invalidate the property.
*Animation* - Raw code: `animation: pulse 1s ease-in-out 0s infinite;`, minified code: `animation: pulse 1s ease-in-out 0s infinite;`, HubSpot minification: `animation: pulse 1s ease-in-out 0 infinite;` - Notice the missing `s`. This causes Chrome to invalidate the property.

Yeah, with the new Design Manager the ability to edit source code on Rich Text modules has been removed. A lot of times a marketer would come into the source code and change what a developer build and then fundamentally break the page/design. 

We're considering options to ensure this option remains (such as the edit source code button only shows up for folks with specific user permissions)
<@U7W3EP1A6> I know this is a stupid question, but have you tried un-minifying the css before adding it to HubSpot?

I had some problems time ago with minimifed too.
I suggest to move out the designer, as you already have it minimized and load it from the file manager so it is ignored by the minimizer by HS.
Then you can report the error so they can fix at some point.

If for some reason you are really interested in keep it inside the designer, you can try adding {% raw %} tags wrapping the CSS minimized, I don't know if this would be ignored by the minimizer but you can try.

So, I have a workflow that was working great for me, but now seems to be broken since the updates to content settings.  I prefer to style sites by writing .SCSS and compiling to a .CSS file that's running on localhost:3000.  I essentially use this as a staging environment before pushing changes to the live .CSS file in HubSpot.  

Since the recent updates to content settings, the styles from `<link rel="stylesheet" href="http://localhost:3000/custom/styles/default/hs_default_custom_style.css">` no longer load.

The link is there in the `<head>` but none of the styles actually apply.  

Anyone else doing this/experiencing something similar?
Are you getting an error in the console? My first thought would be an http vs https issue.
good call <@U26BLKGE4>
it's attempting to access it at https despite the reference in the head being http.  Any thoughts on a workaround?
that I'm not sure of... never tried to apply an SSL cert to localhost lol
You can self sign an ssl
